noun.description: The process or result of joining two or more things together to form a single entity.
examples: a fusion of an idea from anthropology and an idea from psychology
malformation or fusion of the three bones in the middle ear

adjective.description: Referring to food or cooking that incorporates elements of diverse cuisines.
examples: their fusion fare includes a sushi-like roll of gingery rice and eel wrapped in marinated Greek grape leaves

origin: Mid 16th century: from Latin fusio(n-), from fundere pour, melt.
